intro: Adenosma capitata var. spicata, commonly known as the spiculate adenosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
